description: A captain was sailing when his ship hit a storm.  The only way to prevent the ship from sinking was to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard; which he did; and the ship was saved.
The captain had throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard to survive.

A captain of a ship was at sea when a big storm came upon his boat. The boat was too heavy and the only thing he could do to prevent it from capsizing was to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard. Doing so; he saved the ship and himself and returned ome safely.
There was a storm at sea.  The Captain knew that his boat would not survive unless he threw his wifes expensive luggage into the sea and he did it.
The boat was in a horrible storm and in order for them to survive the captain had to throw his wives baggage overboard. They survived.

A captain of a ship was in a bad storm and was going to sink because his ship was too heavy. He had to throw something overboard so he chose all his wife's expensives possessions and jewelry; which he tossed overboard. He then survived and escaped safely.
The captain of the ship decided to perserve lives by making a decision to forfit his wife's expensive cargo.  He threw the cargo overboard; the ship did not sink and they both survived.
There was a ship in a storm with heavy cargo that belong to his wife.  The captain threw the expensive cargo overboard to avoid sinking.
The ship was about to sink and the captain decided to toss his wife's expensive cargo overboard to stay afloat.
A captain was sailing on stormy seas. The only way to avoid sinking was to make the ship lighter so threw his wife's cargo overboard.
There was a huge storm that threatened to sink the ship.  In order to save the ship and his life; the captain through some of his wife's cargo overboard.
A captain was out at sea during a large storm. He had to throw his wife's cargo overboard in order to prevent the ship from flooding.

There was a bad storm while a ship was at sea and the captain of the ship noticed the ship was too heavy so he threw over his wife's stuff to make sure the ship didn't go down. They were fine and went home safely.
I didn't get a chance to read it; my browser skipped forward and I can't go back. D: I apologize!

The captain was operating a ship that  appeared to be overloaded;But in order for it not to sink he had to remove a few items which happened to be his wife's expensive cargo which prevented the boat/ship from sinking.
There was a storm at sea.  The boat captain had to make the decision to throw his wife's cargo overboard to save his boat from sinking.
A ship captain and his wife were at sea during a storm.  The captain threw his wife's cargo overboard to make the ship lighter so it wouldn't sink.

A captain was on a ship when the waves got bigger and the ship was at risk of flooding since it was too heavy. The captain only survived  because he made the decision to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard to make the ship lighter.
Captain was sailing very rough seas and his boat was taking on water.  In order to prevent the ship from sinking he had to toss His wife's expensive cargo overboard.
The captain had to make a decision on whether to let the ship flood; or throw his wife's cargo in the sea and save himself and the boat.
A captain of a ship was caught in a storm and realized that his only chance of survival was to throw his wife's expensive possessions right into the sea.
A captain of a ship had to save the ship from sinking by dumping his wife's expensive cargo overboard. The ship survived; and he was able to make it back home to his wife.
A ship's captain made a decision to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard; in order to save his ship in a storm.
The captain of a ship had to make a quick decision in order to prevent his boat from sinking. He chose to throw his wife's truck of expensive items overboard.
There was a storm and they were on a ship; the only way to save themselves was to throw his wife's cargo off of the boat.
A captain jettisoned expensive cargo to stay afloat during a storm.
A sea captain had to decide how to keep his boat from sinking. He chose to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard.
The captain had to make a decision to survive from and storm or throw his wifes expensive cargo overboard. He threw the cargo to survive.

A captain was sailing a small boat on the ocean when a storm began. To keep the boat from sinking; he made the decision to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard; and it sank; he was able to survive the storm.
The captain of the ship threw expensive cargo overboard to save himself and the ship during a storm.
A storm came upon the captain and his boat. In an effort to save lives; he threw his wife's expensive cargo overboard because the boat was too heavy.
A huge storm came up while a ship's captain was bringing his wife expensive cargo.  The only way he could survive was to throw the cargo overboard; which he did.
A terrible storm was coming; and the only way to survive; was to make the ship lighter so it wouldn't flood and sink. The captain thought quickly; and threw his wife's cargo overboard to survive.
Ship was going to sink.  Captain threw wife's stuff overboard/
Boat was sinking.  Needed to lose weight.  Capatin threw over his wife exspensive cargo and was safe.
It was storming and in order to save his ship and his self ; the captian throw his wife's things over board.
A captain was sailing a small vessel in the ocean during a storm. He wouldn't have survived if he didn't throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard.
A ship was sinking and needed to lose weight to stay afloat. The captain threw his wife's expensive things off the boat and it didn't sink.
The ship was going to sink in the storm if the captain didn't make the boat lighter. So he tossed his wifes stuff overboard.
The captain was out at sea and there was a storm. He realized the ship would flood if he didn't make the ship lighter; so he threw his wife's expensive cargo overboard.

A captain was out on his boat when a storm started; the waves so were strong that he was afraid he would flood and sink. Knowing the only way to survive was to toss his cargo overboard; he did the only thing he could and tossed his wife's expensive cargo ver the side.
A captain was sailing and realized he would sink. He threw his wive's luggage overboard to lighten the load; and he made it home.
Something happend to the sea captain  during the voige
A ship was about to sink under the waves.  The captain had his wife's costly cargo on board and threw it overboard because it was the only way not to capsize.
Ship was sinking. Captain threw wife's expensive chests into ocean to save himself and the ship.
A storm hit a small boat that was too heavy. The captain had to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard to keep the boat from sinking.
A sailor was out to sea and there was a storm that could have killed him.  In order to survive; the sailor dumped his wife's cargo off of the ship.
The captain throws wife's expensive cargo overboard in order to save the ship from sinking.
A ship's captain had to throw his wife's expensive cargo over board because it was too heavy for the ship to stay afloat during a storm.
To make the boat lighter; the captain had to get rid of some things on board so they could get home safely. He got rid of his wife's cargo.
this huge storm was about to capsize the boat so the captain threw the expensive cargo overboard
The captain of a ship had to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard to avoid from the ship sinking due to the intense sea weather.
A captain was forced to throw his wife's expensive cargo overboard in order to save himself and his ship.
A storm threatened a sea vessel. The captain threw cargo overboard to keep the ship from capsizing.

There was a bad storm; the captain and the boat would sink if it was not make lighter. The captain decided he had to throw away his wive's expensive cargo in order to stay afloat so he did. He survived.

A storm at sea was threatening the captain's ship with big waves that could sink it.  In order to lighten the ship the captain decided to throw his wife's expensive; heavy luggage overboard and was able to make it back home.
The captain was worried about is small boat capsizing due to heavy load so he threw out his wife's expensive stuff.

Even though the cargo was his wife's and expensive in order to save himself he did what he thought was best. Given that most captains are experienced sailors I would think that any alternative to tossing the cargo overboard would have been taken by the catain first given the cost to himself personally.
FINDING OTHER HEAVY THINGS TO THROW OVERBOARD.
He could have  thrown his wife overboard.
He could have gotten rid of his stuff or other people's stuff on the boat. He also could have thrown someone overboard.
He could have left the cargo onboard and hoped that the ship survived
He could have looked around for more items which he could have tossed. He could have went down with the ship. Without knowing more; that's about all I can come up with.
He could have looked for other cargo to throw overboard; attempted to ride out the storm; or abandoned ship in a lifeboat or other escape craft.
he could have looked for other things to throw over. Butt I think he made a good choice being as it was a life or death scenrio.
he could have not thrown it overboard and died
He could have thrown his wife overboard. He probably made the right decision.
He could have thrown other cargo overboard.  He could have abandoned the ship himself.  He could have thrown other people overboard.
He could have thrown other things overboard that would be the same weight. His wifes cargo was the most expendable commodity at the time of his decision.
He could have thrown other things overboard; but he probably needed them for the ship or he could have let the ship sink. I think he made the right choice.
He could have thrown out essential items for the sake of sentimental items.

He could have tried as hard as possible to keep the ship afloat without throwing his wife's cargo. 

If he succeeded in keep the ship afloat; with the cargo intact; he would be her hero.

If the ship sank and he died; he wouldn't have to hear her compain (or bear the shame of his failure; whatever).

If the ship sank and he lived; he would be able to argue that he did everything possible to save the cargo.

He could have used greater caution in choosing his route across the ocean and avoided the sorm in the first place.

He could have shipped his wife's cargo on a vessel that he wasn't captaining to avoid any sort of personal conflict like this.

he could have tried to sail out the storm.
he could have let the boat sink
He could've thrown his own stuff overboard.
He probably couldn't afford to throw anything else aboard because he might have needed the other things. His wife's cargo might have been expensive; but it wasn't worth more than his life.
He valued his life more than his wifes expensive cargo and ultimately saved his life.   His only other decision was to drown with his wifes cargo.
He was probably happy to do it. He could have just tried to steer the vessel to safety instead of throwing out luggage
His life was more valuable than any possesion on that boat; her cargo can be replaced as long as it wasn't a living being

His wife will definitely be mad but it is better than the ship sinking.  I am sure that he could have also thrown off food or equipment; but that stuff is more important than clothing and jewelry.  The stuff that was thrown over can be somewhat replaced.

I guess he could have decided not to throw her cargo overboard. Thus the whole ship would have sank; along with the cargo and the captain. He might have been able to throw over non-essential cargo that was not his wife's. But we don't know that from the ifo proivded.

I suppose he could have thrown himself or his crew overboard; or if he had some other equally heavy but less expensive cargo he could have thrown that overboard. Alternatively; he could have allowed the ship to sink.

I think he made a wise decision; considering he was near his death. I don't think it would be reasonable to consider other decisions; as he was in a life or death; sink or swim (literally) situation. He acted on instinct to save his life; and had he spentmore time considering options; he may not have made it.

I think he made the only decision he could have mad. It was his life or her cargo and a human life is worth more than any cargo could ever be no matter how expensive. That was the only thing he could have done.

I think maybe he could have thrown off some furniture instead. I don't know the circumstances of the boat; but maybe he could have thrown off some extra food; too. There were probably other things that could be thrown off that weren't essential to the boas survival.
I think that was the best option. Otherwise; he'd have to possibly sacrifice the lives or possessions of his crew; which would be much less acceptable.
I think the captain made the right decision; and I don't believe there was no other choice to be made. The story didn't list anything else he could have thrown overboard.

I think this was an easy decision for the captain.  In comparison to dying on a sinking ship; losing expensive cargo is nothing.  He may have had a momentary thought that his wife would be a little upset; but he probably quickly realized that she would unerstand.  There may have been other items onboard that he could have thrown over like his suitcases and any cargo his ship was carrying that wasn't his wives.
I'm not sure he had a choice. It was either throw the cargo overboard; or risk losing the ship and his life. He could have chosen to go down with the ship; but that's not really a good idea.
I'm not sure what other items he had on the ship; but he seemed to have made the right decision in tosser her cargo over.
In order to save he life I do not think that he could have made any other decision.  I honestly believe he did the best thing that he could by putting his life before material things.
In this scenario it was life or death and although his wife may be mad in the short term i'm sure she will be grateful that he is still alive because of his decision.

it depends what was on the ship. If there were other heavy objects that he could have thrown I would have thrown them first; but as a last resort; I would think that whatever the "cargo" was; it could be replaced; better to be safe; and lose the "cargo" tan take a chance and have the ship sink.
It seems like the only other decision he could have made was to let the boat capsize. Material things are not worth your life.
It was a good decision. Everyone is still alive; so that's what's most important.
It was better than throwing her or his crew overboard. Unless there were items of sentimental value; what he tossed can probably be replaced.

It would be a wise thing to do considering he'd have lost a lot more if he hadn't done that. He could have lost everything including his life had he not thrown it overboard. If there was something else to throw overboard; he may have done that instead.
Presumably that was the only decision he could have made. Anything else he could have thrown overboard was probably essential to the operation of the vessel.

The captain could have thrown anything else that was inside overboard. His wife's cargo was probably the easiest to carry and throw; so he decided to go for that first. He could have looked for less obvious items.

The captain could have thrown his own cargo overboard. The captain could have thrown someone's else's cargo overboard. The fact that he threwhis wife's cargo overboard says something about how he feels about his wife. Maybe he wanted to throw her overboar but did not want to commit a crime.

The captain wisely chose to save the boat and his life by getting rid of the heavy cargo. The cargo is replaceable. The boat could be used to salvage the cargo later; if it wasn't too deep. 
Other than monitoring the weather more closely in order to keepout the storm.... I think losing the cargo was the best decision.

The ship was going to flood unless the captain could somehow make it lighter. Therefore almost every decision he could possibly make in that situation involved throwing something overboard in order to lighten the ship and survive the storm. The captain cold possibly have jettisoned the lifeboats; but that would have put the lives of the crew at risk. He could have thrown other supplies apart from the expensive cargo overboard; but againt hat could have endangered the lives of his crew; or made the journeyhome very difficult and uncomfortable. There may have been other cargo on the boat he could have thrown overboard; but it seems that this was not as good an option or he would not have thrown his wife's cargo. He could possibly have sailed out of the stor; back-tracked or taken an alternative route.

Ultimately; I think he made a right choice to sacrifice his wife's cargo. Though it was expensive; it essentially saved the entire ship & all its people. However; because I'm unsure of what else he had available on the ship that he could throw overboard;  cannot conclude whether this particular decision was the best option for the captain.

Wasn't there anything else he could toss out? He could have tossed more of lighter items; that were not needed or quite so precious as his wife's stuff. He could have focused on doing that and then bailing water. As a last resort; toss his wife's stuff.

Well he could have thrown his wife over so I guess he chose wisely!  It is the logicial choice to throw her "stuff" over - things are not important especially when life is at risk.  Perhaps he could have thrown some ship furniture off instead if he wantedto keep his loss lower?

Well I think from the information given; that his decision to throw his wife's cargo overboard was a good one. He had to think fast and that was what came to him. If his wife cares more about her expensive stuff then maybe it was for the best anyhow..win-in..he throws the stuff overboard and his wife his happy that he is alive..he throws his wife's cargo overboard and learns some very important things about his wife.
